abstract: If you notice certain programs are open already when you log in to your Mac, you can change the settings to alter their behavior.
snippet: If you notice certain programs are open already when you log in to your Mac, you can change the settings to alter their behavior.
lead_paragraph: Q. When I turn on my Mac, I notice the Dock shows Google Chrome always open, even though the browser window doesn’t appear on screen and I’m not opening the program myself. Why is this and how do I turn it off?

headline.main: Stopping OS X Apps From Automatically Starting
